docs.snippet: Brazil reaffirmed its reputation as a powerhouse of global soccer in the opening match of the World Cup, but its widening political fissures were also on display for an international audience....
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil reaffirmed its reputation as a powerhouse of global soccer in the opening match of the World Cup, but its widening political fissures were also on display for an international audience.
docs.abstract: Political discord is on display for international audience as Brazil kicks off opening match at World Cup in Sao Paulo; protests both during and around match reflect anxieties and discontent over economic slowdown, spending on stadiums and reports of corruption involving FIFA, organization that oversees international soccer and World Cup.

headline.main: Soccer and Internal Discord, on Display for World to See
headline.print_headline: Soccer and Internal Discord, on Display for World to See

docs.lead_paragraph: Global soccer needs to move on from Blatter, the president of FIFA, who has shown no willingness to confront corruption in his sport.
docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column; Sepp Blatter, in his fourth term president of FIFA, is likely to run for a fifth, despite his bizarre statements and many accusations of corruption.

headline.main: Questioning the Unimaginable: A Fifth FIFA Term for Sepp Blatter
headline.print_headline: Questioning the Unimaginable: A Fifth FIFA Term for Blatter

docs.abstract: Stuart Elliott Advertising column notes that Nationwide Insurance will expand its roster of agencies to include Ogilvy & Mather Advertising New York; will award agency with an assignment to create campaigns surrounding company's five-year marketing deal with Denver Broncos quarterback Payton Manning.
